heading: campaign déjà vu
subheading: in an unusual move, republican john mccain and democrat bill bradley are planning a joint meeting to highlight their support for campaign finance reform. the session will likely take place in claremont, new hampshire, the exact location for the 1995 campaign finance reform pledge by clinton and then-house speaker newt gingrich. though trailing behind in most states, mccain and bradley are competing for the lead in the new hampshire polls. the nation's first primary will be held there 1 february.
author: wired staff
